name: ACEPTOR TABLETS (2.5/5/10MG)
shortDescription: Aceptor tablets contain the active ingredient Benazepril Hydrochloride, classified as an ACE inhibitor primarily designed for veterinary use in dogs and cats. This vasodilator medication functions by inhibiting the angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE), contributing to vasodilation, thereby controlling hypertension and reducing proteinuria associated with Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD).
fullDescription: ACEPTOR Tablets contain Benazepril, classified as an ACE inhibitor, which functions by inhibiting an enzyme known as Angiotensin Converting Enzyme (ACE). This action aids in the relaxation (dilatation) of blood vessels, resulting in the reduction of blood pressure.For senior cats, early detection of health issues is crucial. Encouraging regular health checkups for cats can be a part of disease prevention.Excessive thirst and reduced appetite are common clinical indications of chronic renal insufficiency in dogs and cats. Benazepril supports pets suffering from chronic renal insufficiency, contributing to their extended, healthier, and happier lives.
action: ACEPTOR Tablets contain Benazepril, classified as an ACE inhibitor, which functions by inhibiting an enzyme known as Angiotensin Converting Enzyme (ACE). This action aids in the relaxation (dilatation) of blood vessels, resulting in the reduction of blood pressure.
For senior cats, early detection of health issues is crucial. Encouraging regular health checkups for cats can be a part of disease prevention.

Excessive thirst and reduced appetite are common clinical indications of chronic renal insufficiency in dogs and cats. Benazepril supports pets suffering from chronic renal insufficiency, contributing to their extended, healthier, and happier lives.
numbers: Conveniently available in strips of 10 chewable tablets (Box of 3 strips).
uses: Effective in managing high blood pressure/Hypertension.
Supplementary treatment for hypertrophic cardiomyopathies (HCM), diminishing wall thickness
Addresses dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM) and Mitral Valve Disease (MVD)
Mitigates protein loss linked to Chronic Renal Failure (CKD)
dosage: Dog: 0.25-0.5mg/kg bw once daily
Cat: 0.5mg/kg bw once daily
Route: Oral administration
Species: Suitable for Dogs and Cats
warning: Avoid use in pets with hypotension or cardiac output failure.
Caution is required when administered with diuretics, beta-blockers, or other vasodilators, as it may lead to hypotension
instruction: Store in a cool, dry place at room temperature or below 25°C.
Keep out of reach of children.
safety: Safety is not established for cats weighing less than 2.5 kg and in pregnant or lactating dogs and cats. Use in such patients should be carefully considered, weighing potential risks.
note: Always consult a veterinarian before administering Aceptor Tablets to ensure the appropriate dosage and usage for your pet's specific health needs. Regular health check-ups for early detection and monitoring are beneficial, especially for senior cats, ensuring they lead longer, healthier lives.

name: DOXYPET TABLETS (100MG, 200MG, AND 300MG)
shortDescription: Doxypet tablets contain doxycycline hydrochloride combined with lactic acid bacillus spores. Doxycycline, classified as a tetracycline antibiotic, operates as a bacteriostatic agent. Its mechanism involves the inhibition of protein synthesis at the initiation stage by interacting with the 30S ribosomal subunit.
composition: Doxypet 300 Tablet contains: Doxycycline hydrochloride - 300 mg, Lactic acid bacillus spores - 300 million, Excipients - QS, Colour: Sunset Yellow
Doxypet 200 Tablet contains,Doxycycline hydrochloride - 200 mg, Lactic acid bacillus spores - 200 million, Excipients - QS
Doxypet 100 Tablet contains,Doxycycline hydrochloride - 100 mg,Lactic acid bacillus spores - 100 million, Excipients - QS, Colour: Quinoline Yellow
action: Doxycycline serves as a versatile treatment for various bacterial and protozoal infections found in dogs and cats. It effectively targets conditions such as leptospirosis, toxoplasmosis, mycoplasmosis, psittacosis, Lyme disease, ehrlichiosis, rocky mountain spotted fever, and other tick-borne diseases. Additionally, it proves beneficial in managing respiratory tract infections, urinary tract infections, skin issues, and wounds. Moreover, Doxycycline exhibits efficacy in treating heartworm disease by combating the Wolbachia organism responsible for heartworm infections. However, it's important to note that Doxycycline is not effective against viruses or fungi. For feline chlamydophilosis, a treatment duration of 3-4 weeks is recommended.
uses: Doxycycline serves as a remedy for various bacterial and protozoal infections prevalent in dogs and cats.
It effectively combats bacterial infections such as leptospirosis, toxoplasmosis, mycoplasmosis, psittacosis, Lyme disease, ehrlichiosis, and rocky mountain spotted fever/tick fever.
Apart from these, it addresses respiratory, urinary tract, skin, and wound infections efficiently.
Doxycycline demonstrates efficacy in treating heartworm disease by targeting the Wolbachia organism that infects heartworms.
It's important to note that doxycycline does not exhibit effectiveness against viruses or fungi.
Feline chlamydophilosis necessitates a treatment duration of 3-4 weeks when using doxycycline.
dosage: Administer at a rate of 10 mg/kg body weight per day or according to your veterinarian's guidance.
Treatment duration for Ehrlichiosis : Up to 28 days
Treatment duration for Babesiosis : Up to 14 days
Treatment duration for Leptospirosis : Up to 21 days
Treatment duration for Lyme disease : Up to 28 days
For oral administration exclusively.
The tablets are divisible, allowing administration based on the individual's body weight to ensure accurate doses.
warning: If overdosing occurs, discontinue immediately and seek veterinary or medical attention. Common side effects include nausea, vomiting, drooling, and diarrhea. Oesophagitis is commonly observed, hence administering with water is recommended. Not suitable for pets allergic to doxycycline. Avoid combining with specific medications and supplements, as detailed in the instructions.
instruction: Store in a cool, dry place below 30°C, away from direct sunlight and moisture.
Keep out of reach of children.
safety: Avoid usage in pets younger than 7 months, as it may cause teeth discoloration. Not recommended for pregnant or breeding animals due to potential skeletal alterations in developing offspring. Always adhere to recommended doses, and if a dose is missed, do not double it.
This medication has no habit-forming tendencies and doesn't entail withdrawal effects.
note: Always consult a veterinarian before administering Doxypet Tablets to ensure the appropriate dosage and usage for your pet's specific health needs.

name: SAFEHEART TABLETS (1.25 MG, 5 MG AND 10 MG)
shortDescription: SafeHeart includes Pimobendan as a constituent. Pimobendan is a non-sympathomimetic, non-glycoside inotropic medication known for its vasodilatory impact. It is used to address symptoms associated with varying levels of congestive heart failure (modified New York Heart Association = NYHA class IIa, IIIb, IVc), manage issues linked to Arterioventricular Valvular Insufficiency (AVVI), and treat Dilated Cardiomyopathy (DCM) in canines.
composition: SafeHeart 1.25 mg Tablet contains: Pimobendan Ph. Eur (EP) - 1.25 mg, Excipients - q.s., Approved flavours, Colour: Iron oxide red, Iron Oxide Yellow NF
SafeHeart 5mg Tablet contains: Pimobendan Ph. Eur (EP) - 5 mg, Excipients - q.s., Approved flavours,Colour: Iron oxide red, Iron Oxide Yellow NF
SafeHeart 10mg Tablet contains: Pimobendan Ph. Eur (EP) - 10 mg, Excipients - q.s., Approved flavours, Colour: Iron oxide red, Iron Oxide Yellow NF
action: SafeHeart contains Pimobendan, characterized as a non-sympathomimetic and non-glycoside inotropic drug with vasodilator properties. This compound belongs to the benzimidazole-pyridazinone derivative group. Pimobendan operates through a dual mechanism, enhancing the sensitivity of cardiac myofilaments to calcium and inhibiting phosphodiesterase (type III), thereby stimulating the myocardium. Following oral intake, pimobendan undergoes demethylation, conjugates with sulphate or glucuronic acid, and is eliminated through feces.
uses: Addressing symptoms associated with mild, moderate, or severe congestive heart failure, categorized under modified New York Heart Association (NYHA) class IIa, IIIb, IVc. These stages encompass:
o Class II Heart Failure – Characterized by fatigue, shortness of breath, and coughing appearing when ordinary exercise is surpassed
o Class III Heart Failure – Dogs are comfortable at rest, but their exercise capacity is limited.
o Class IV Heart Failure – Dogs exhibit no capacity for exercise, experiencing disabling clinical signs.
Managing arterioventricular valvular insufficiency (AVVI).
Treating and managing Dilated Cardiomyopathy (DCM) in dogs.
dosage: Pimobendan, also known as Safe Heart, should be administered at a dosage of 0.5 mg/kg body weight per day, constituting the total dose.
The overall dose should be divided into two parts and administered at 12-hour intervals, although the divided tablet portions might not be of equal size.
Route: Oral and can be administered by mixing or giving it along with food.
Species: This medication is specifically designed for oral use in dogs as a cardiac drug.
Duration: For dogs facing cardiac issues, the therapy might be required for the entirety of their life span.
warning: If an overdose occurs, promptly consult a veterinarian for guidance and advice.

Typical adverse effects observed in dogs treated with pimobendan or SafeHeart include reduced appetite, breathing difficulties, sluggishness, increased levels of nitrogen compounds in the blood (azotemia), diarrhea, and diminished strength. Severe side effects may manifest as lack of coordination (ataxia), accumulation of fluid around the lungs (pleural effusion), fainting (syncope), coughing, accumulation of fluid in the abdomen (ascites), abnormal heart sounds (heart murmurs), and potentially death.
Avoid administering this medication without proper diagnosis and guidance from a veterinarian.
instruction: Keep stored in a cool, dry location within the temperature range of 25°C to 30°C.
This product is not intended for human use. If accidentally ingested by humans, seek immediate medical consultation from a physician.
Specifically designated for veterinary purposes. Keep it out of the reach of children.
safety: The safety of SafeHeart in breeding and pregnant animals has not been established. Additionally, its safety remains undetermined in dogs younger than 6 months old, those with diabetes mellitus, congenital heart conditions, or other significant metabolic ailments.

SafeHeart can be administered alongside various medications such as furosemide, digoxin, enalapril, atenolol, spironolactone, nitroglycerine, antiparasitic drugs, antibiotics like penicillins, fluoroquinolones, metronidazole, as well as topical ophthalmic and otic preparations, thyroid medicines, butorphanol, metoclopramide, among others.

Adherence to recommended guidelines is crucial. Abrupt discontinuation of the medication may result in severe adverse effects. Always heed your veterinarian's guidance, as additional supportive medications might be necessary based on the severity of your pet's cardiac condition.
Habit-forming: Lifelong medication may be necessary for heart-related conditions.
note: Always consult a veterinarian before administering SafeHeart Tablets to ensure the appropriate dosage and usage for your pet's specific health needs.

name: CARODYL TABLETS (100MG/75MG/25 MG)
shortDescription: Carodyl 100, Carodyl 75, and Carodyl 25 tablets have carprofen as their active ingredient. Carprofen works by mainly targeting the COX-2 enzyme, reducing the production of specific prostaglandins associated with inflammation. It has properties that help reduce fever, inflammation, and pain. This medication belongs to the propionic acid class of NSAIDs, which includes ibuprofen and ketoprofen among others.
composition: Carodyl 25 chewable tablet contains: Carprofen IP - 25 mg,Excipients - q.s.
Carodyl 75 chewable tablet contains: Carprofen IP - 75 mg, Excipients - q.s.
Carodyl 100 chewable tablet contains: Carprofen IP - 100 mg,Excipients - q.s.
action: Carodyl 100, Carodyl 75, and Carodyl 25 contain carprofen, which selectively blocks the COX-2 enzyme, reducing the production of inflammation-related prostaglandins. It holds properties that relieve fever, inflammation, and pain. Belonging to the propionic acid class of NSAIDs like ibuprofen and ketoprofen, carprofen undergoes liver metabolism and is eliminated through bile secretion.
numbers: Available in extensive presentation as strips and Economy value pack for dosing convenience.
uses: Carodyl 100, Carodyl 75, and Carodyl 25, which contain carprofen, are recommended for dogs in the following cases:
o Managing and alleviating pain as well as inflammation linked with osteoarthritis.
o Regulating postoperative pain related to soft tissue.
o Managing postoperative pain linked to orthopedic surgeries in dogs.
Managing arterioventricular valvular insufficiency (AVVI).
Treating and managing Dilated Cardiomyopathy (DCM) in dogs.
dosage: For dogs aged over 6 weeks, the suggested dosage is 4 mg per kilogram of body weight once a day or split into 2 mg per kilogram of body weight twice daily.
This medication is intended for oral use exclusively.
warning: An overdose can lead to severe side effects and gastrointestinal symptoms such as vomiting, diarrhea, presence of blood in stool, dark or tarry stools, and reduced appetite. Gastrointestinal issues might arise with carprofen usage, similar to other NSAIDs. If these symptoms persist for more than a day or two, discontinuing the treatment is advised.
Avoid administering carprofen to dehydrated, hypovolemic, or hypotensive patients, or those with gastrointestinal conditions or blood clotting irregularities.
Combining carprofen with steroids is not recommended due to increased ulcer risk. A minimum 24-hour gap is advised between their usage as they can heighten ulcer formation when used simultaneously.
A suitable interval between switching from NSAIDs to steroids, or vice versa, is important to prevent complications or adverse reactions.
Manufacturer's recommendation: not suitable for use in cats.
instruction: Store the medication in a cool, dry place at room temperature or below 30°C, and protect it from light exposure.
Ensure it's kept out of reach of both children and dogs.
Remember, this product is solely intended for veterinary use.
safety: Avoid using if there's a known hypersensitivity to any active ingredients or additional components. Refrain from using in dogs with cardiac, renal, or hepatic conditions. There's no specific guidance regarding age-related restrictions, safety during breeding, or for lactating animals. Safety hasn't been confirmed for animals younger than 6 weeks old.
Adhere to the prescribed dosage. No withdrawal side effects have been reported.
note: Always consult a veterinarian before administering Carodyl Tablets to ensure the appropriate dosage and usage for your pet's specific health needs.

name: KIWOF HART TABLETS
shortDescription: Kiwof Hart tablets are employed to prevent and treat heartworm disease in dogs. They efficiently eliminate and expel heartworms. A pet can contract heartworm disease from a single mosquito bite. This disease, also known as Dirofilariasis, is caused by Dirofilaria immitis, a parasitic roundworm that inflicts substantial damage to the heart and lungs. It's a zoonotic disease, potentially fatal for both animals and humans.
composition: Small Dogs (Upto 11kg): Each Chewable tablet contains: Ivermectin BP - 68 mcg, Pyrantel Pamoate USP, Equivalent to Pyrantel - 57 mg, Excipients - q.s.
Medium Dogs (12-22kg): Each Chewable tablet contains: Ivermectin BP - 136 mcg, Pyrantel Pamoate USP, Equivalent to Pyrantel - 114 mg, Excipients - q.s.
Large Dogs (23-45kg): Each Chewable tablet contains: Ivermectin BP - 272 mcg, Pyrantel Pamoate USP, Equivalent to Pyrantel - 227 mg, Excipients - q.s.
action: Carodyl 100, Carodyl 75, and Carodyl 25 contain carprofen, which selectively blocks the COX-2 enzyme, reducing the production of inflammation-related prostaglandins. It holds properties that relieve fever, inflammation, and pain. Belonging to the propionic acid class of NSAIDs like ibuprofen and ketoprofen, carprofen undergoes liver metabolism and is eliminated through bile secretion.
numbers: Available in a package of 6 easy chews (Tablets).
uses: Prevents the growth of the adult stage of Dirofilaria immitis.
Effectively combats the tissue larval stage of Dirofilaria immitis.
Manages both hookworms and roundworms.
Administered once a month with easy chews.
dosage: Small Dogs (Up to 11kg): 1 Easy Chew based on their specific weight range.
Medium (12 – 22kg): 1 Easy Chew based on their specific weight range.
Large (23 – 45kg): 1 Easy Chew based on their specific weight range.
For dogs weighing over 45 kg, use the suitable combination of tablets as directed.
Alternatively, follow the guidance provided by a veterinarian.
The suggested dosage of ivermectin for heartworm disease is 60mcg per 10kg of body weight, with a maximum allowable dose of 120mcg.
Route: Oral only
Species: Dogs only
warning: When switching from another heartworm preventive product as part of a heartworm disease prevention program, the initial dose of KIWOF HART should be administered within a month (30 days) of the last dose of the previous medication. The effectiveness of ivermectin might decrease if there's a gap exceeding one month (30 days) between doses.

In trials involving ivermectin alone, some dogs exhibited mild hypersensitivity-type reactions, notably transient diarrhea, likely triggered by the presence of dead or dying microfilariae, following treatment in cases where circulating microfilariae were present.

Throughout clinical trials, dogs experienced side effects such as depression, lethargy, vomiting, reduced appetite, diarrhea, enlarged pupils, lack of coordination, stumbling, seizures, and increased saliva production.
instruction: Store in a cool, dry place at room temperature or below 25°C.
Keep out of the reach of children.
safety: It is recommended for dogs aged at least 6 weeks old. Studies indicate that Collies might be more sensitive to high doses of ivermectin (exceeding 16 times the intended level) compared to other breeds.
KIWOF HART has demonstrated a considerable safety margin at the prescribed dosage in various dog categories, including pregnant or breeding females and stud dogs.
note: Note: Always consult a veterinarian before administering Kiwof Hart Tablets to ensure the appropriate dosage and usage for your pet's specific health needs.

name: KIWOF PLUS / KIWOF PLUS XL TABLETS
shortDescription: Kiwof Plus and Kiwof Plus XL tablets contain three distinct active ingredients, each with unique ways of functioning and target ranges. Praziquantel targets cestodes, specifically tapeworms. Pyrantel pamoate combats hookworms and ascarids. Febantel acts against nematode parasites, which include whipworms in its spectrum of activity.
composition: Kiwof Plus chewable tablet contains: Praziquantel - 50 mg, Pyrantel Pamoate - 144 mg, Febantel - 150 mg
Kiwof Plus XL chewable tablet contains, Praziquantel - 175 mg, Pyrantel Pamoate - 504 mg, Febantel - 525 mg
action: Kiwof Plus and Kiwof Plus XL tablets contain three active components with distinct mechanisms and ranges of effectiveness. Praziquantel targets cestodes, specifically tapeworms. It's absorbed, metabolized in the liver, and excreted via bile. Once in the digestive tract, it exhibits cestocidal activity, making tapeworms vulnerable to digestion by the host. As a result, complete tapeworms, including their scolices, are rarely passed after praziquantel administration. Instead, disintegrated and partially digested tapeworm pieces are often observed in stool, as most tapeworms are digested and not found in feces.

Pyrantel pamoate is effective against hookworms and ascarids by acting on the nematode's cholinergic receptors, causing spastic paralysis. The parasite is then expelled through the intestinal tract due to peristaltic action.

Febantel targets nematode parasites, including whipworms. It's swiftly absorbed and metabolized within the animal. Based on available data, it disrupts the parasite's energy metabolism, leading to a breakdown in energy exchange and inhibiting glucose uptake.
numbers: Kiwof Plus – 1 x 10 tablets, Kiwof Plus XL – 1 x 4 tablets
uses: Kiwof Plus and Kiwof Plus XL Tablets are utilized for routine deworming in dogs.
Effective in removing and controlling tapeworms like Echincoccus multilocularis, Taenia pisiformis, Dipylidium caninum, and Echinococcus granulosus.
Also proficient in eliminating Ascarids (Toxocara canis, Toxascaris leonina), Hookworms (Ancylostoma caninum, Uncinaria stenocephala), and Whipworms (Trichuris vulpis) in dogs.
dosage: Kiwof Plus XL Tablet Dosage:
o 17.5 kg body weight: ½ KIWOF PLUS XL Tablet
o Over 17.5 kg up to 35 kg body weight: 1 KIWOF PLUS XL Tablet
o Over 35 kg up to 52.5 kg body weight: 1 ½ KIWOF PLUS XL Tablets
o Over 52.5 kg up to 70 kg body weight: 2 KIWOF PLUS XL Tablets
Kiwof Plus Tablet Dosage: 1 tablet for 10 kg of body weight.
Route: Oral only
These tablets can be given directly to the pet or with food.
No starvation is needed before or after treatment.

Frequency:For regular management of worms and deworming in dogs, it should be repeated every 3 months. A single dose is recommended for standard treatment. If there's a severe roundworm infestation, the dose should be repeated after 14 days.
warning: Not advised for puppies below 3 months old.
Occasional cases might result in mild vomiting and diarrhea. Adhere to recommended doses, despite its wide safety margin. Contact your veterinarian immediately in case of accidental overdose.

Frequent use of an anthelmintic might lead to the development of parasitic resistance. Avoid simultaneous use with piperazine-containing compounds, as they cause neuromuscular paralysis in worms. Kiwof Plus XL tablets should be used singularly and should not be combined with other dewormers.
It's not universally suitable for all animals. Cats should not receive Kiwof Plus or Kiwof Plus XL dewormers.
Always consult your veterinarian if your dog has liver or hepatic disease or is undergoing any medication
instruction: Store in a cool, dry place.
safety: Avoid use in puppies younger than 3 months old.
Kiwof Plus and Kiwof Plus XL can be used in combination with other treatments such as heartworm prevention, flea and tick treatment, and vaccination.
Consult your veterinarian before administering to pregnant and lactating bitches.
Adhere strictly to recommendations and avoid exceeding the recommended dose when treating pregnant bitches. No withdrawal side effects have been reported.
note: Always consult a veterinarian before administering Kiwof Plus / Kiwof Plus XL Tablets to ensure the appropriate dosage and usage for your pet's specific health needs.
